column4: Hello, I have setup a Ubuntu 10.10 Server but it seems to sleep if I leave it a while. Then, obviously, my servers stop responding. How can I stop it from doing this?
No, I'll go ask there now. Thanks
try:  sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-audio-dev/ppa; sudo apt-get update;sudo apt-get dist-upgrade; killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*
Shall I restart my computer now I have done that?
Okay, see you in a minute :P
try:  echo "options snd-hda-intel model=laptop" | sudo tell -a /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf
Okay, see you in a minute, again :P
you need to change that line in alsa-base.conf   til you find one that works
How many possibilities are there? D:
How do I know what to put in that line of the alsa configuration? D:
find guides online for your make and model system
